column4: I want a command to be executed every start-up.how can set it?
for any user
put all the things you want to bring up at boot (if they are services), in a script, and put it in /etc/init.d/ and add to runtime by using the update-rc.d command
with script you mean a shell script or any kind of script?
usually they are shell, but my guess is that any would work
what do i have to put in the beginning of a shell script I mean in python for example I put #!/usr/bin/python
yep
check SYstem -> Preference -> Layout
check SYstem -> Preference -> Keyboard ->Layout
are you trying to make gkrellm not show up in the panel, but still run it?
exactly
you might need devilspie, apt-get install it, and configure it appropriately

one sec, lemme pull up mine

here's  mine http://omega.uta.edu/~vxv9866/linux/devilspie.xml
modify the example for gnome calculator there, see if you like my settings. else get rid of them!
